tn.text: Here Isaiah continues to describe what it will be like when the king that God has chosen rules. (See: [[:en:bible:notes:isa:11:01|11:1-2]])
It can be stated clearly what time is being referred to. AT: "At that time" or "When the king rules" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

God's wrath is spoken of as if it were a person that could turn away and leave. It means that God has stopped being angry. AT: "You are no longer angry with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

God causing someone's salvation is spoken of as if God were that salvation. The abstract noun "salvation" can be expressed with the noun "savior" or the verb "save". AT: "God causes my salvation" or "God is my savior" or "God is the one who saves me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
God causing someone to be strong is spoken of as if Yahweh were their strength. AT: "Yahweh makes me strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The word "song" here represents what a person sings about. AT: "and the one I joyfully sing about" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation
tn.text: Isaiah speaks of people being saved as if they were getting salvation the way people get water out of well. AT: "you will rejoice when he saves you, as people rejoice when they draw water from a well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Here "his name" refers to Yahweh. Calling on him represents either praising him or asking him for help. AT: "praise him loudly" or "call to him to help you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: declare his deeds among the peoples
tn.text: The noun "deeds" can be expressed with the phrase "what he has done". AT: "Tell the peoples about the great things he has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: proclaim that his name is exalted
tn.text: Here "his name" refers to Yahweh. AT: "proclaim that he is exalted" or "proclaim that he is great" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Isaiah continues to tell what the people will say when the king rules.

tn.ref: for great in your midst is the Holy One of Israel
tn.text: "because the Holy One of Israel, who lives among you, is mighty" or "because the Holy One of Israel is mighty and he lives among you"
